REUTERS VIDEO NEWS UPDATED ADVISORY FOR GERMANY-ELECTION ON SUNDAY SEPTEMBER 24, 2017
(PLEASE NOTE THAT ALL PLANS ARE PROVISIONAL AND SUBJECT TO CHANGE)
    On Sunday September 24, Germany holds federal elections with Chancellor Angela Merkel seeking a fourth term in office.
    Merkel, who has been chancellor since 2005, is widely seen as Europe's most influential politician. She has weathered storms over mass immigration and financial and political turmoil in the European Union, while the SPD, Germany's oldest party has struggled to promote a strong rival.
    The SPD candidate, Martin Schulz's campaign got off to a promising start, but three crushing defeats at the hands of the conservatives in regional elections, including in its heartland of North Rhine-Westphalia, knocked him off course.
    The anti-immigrant Alternative for Germany party is expected to enter the national parliament for the first time.
Reuters Video News will provide extensive coverage of the campaigning in the run up to the election and comprehensive previews.  Our plans for LIVE and edited coverage follow:
SATURDAY SEPTEMBER 16
GERMANY/ELECTION-COALITION BUILDING: VARIOUS - With the three smaller parties neck and neck the race is on to see who will get the coveted third place in the September 24 election. With 7.5 percent the Greens will have to battle for their dream of becoming the third strongest party, Germany's left party will unlikely form a coalition but may steal votes from other parties. The FDP is hoping to use poster boy Christian Lindner to their advantage. Should the party get in, Lindner will have his eyes on the foreign ministry. The AfD might make it into parliament, but all other parties have refused any coalition with them.
:: REUTERS COVER
GERMANY-ELECTION/MERKEL: BINZ/GRIMMEN  - German Chancellor Angela Merkel campaigns in her constituency for her conservative CDU party in Binz on the Baltic Sea island of Ruegen.  (0900GMT Binz / 1100GMT Meets orphaned children)
:: REUTERS COVER ON MERIT
:: Live on RLS Plus 0800GMT and 1115GMT
GERMANY-ELECTION/SCHULZ: FREIBURG - Germany's Social Democratic Party SPD candidate for chancellor Martin Schulz campaigns in Freiburg. (1030GMT Rally starts / 1200GMT approx. speech)
:: REUTERS COVER ON MERIT
:: Live coverage on RLS Plus from 1145GMT
SUNDAY SEPTEMBER 17
GERMANY-ELECTION/MERKEL-EUROPE: VARIOUS - Germany through the looking glass. Greece's view on Merkel's strong EU influence and pro-austerity stance; Bremainers look to Germany with envy and the French view on Merkel now that Macron's star is waning and Poland is the new EU outsider. 
:: REUTERS COVER
GERMANY-ELECTION/MERKEL: BERLIN - Germany's Merkel gives "children's news conference" at CDU headquarters. (1200GMT)
:: REUTERS COVER ON MERIT
:: Live on RLS Plus 
GERMANY-GREENS: BERLIN - GermanyÂ´s Green party political convention. (0900GMT)
:: REUTERS COVER ON MERIT
GERMANY-ELECTION/FDP: BERLIN - Germany's pro-business Free Democratic Party (FDP) holds party conference exactly a week before German election. (0900GMT /1000GMT Leader Christian Lindner speech)
:: REUTERS COVER ON MERIT
MONDAY SEPTEMBER 18
GERMANY-ELECTIONS/MIGRANTS: PASSAU - Two years after Germany welcomed more than one million migrants following German Chancellor Angela Merkel's open door policy, many of them through Passau on the Austrian border, how do locals in the town feel as the chancellor campaigns there.
:: REUTERS COVER
GERMANY-ELECTION/CYBER SECURITY: VARIOUS - Germany's Federal Election Commissioner warns against manipulation attempts. How are the authorities defending the election against a cyber attack and fake news?
:: REUTERS COVER
GERMANY-ELECTION/ISSUES: NORTH RHINE-WESTPHALIA - A look at what issues are important for the German voters and why the Social Democrats anti-inequality message is failing to convince people in Germany's largest state, once a SPD stronghold.
:: REUTERS COVER
GERMANY-ELECTION/SCHAEUBLE: OFFENBURG - German Chancellor Angela Merkel and  EU Commission President Jean-Claude Juncker both speak at Finance Minister Wolfgang Schaeuble 75th birthday reception. (0830GMT Speeches begin)
:: REUTERS COVER - Live on RLS from 0830GMT
:: Live coverage on RLS Plus from 0830GMT
GERMANY-ELECTION/MERKEL: FREIBURG/REGENSBURG/PASSAU - German Chancellor Angela Merkel campaigns in the final week ahead of the election.  She will campaign in Passau on the Austrian border, where several hundred migrants passed through after Merkel opened the borders in 2015. (1030GMT Freiburg / 1400GMT Regensburg / 1630GMT Passau)
:: REUTERS COVER - Edits on merit
